message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CYBER, cs.SI 

The paper uses computational methods (Temporal Difference Reinforcement Learning) to investigate the affective, cognitive and behavioural processes involved in risk taking, which suggests it could belong to the sub-categories of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI), Machine Learning (cs.LG), and Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE). The paper also discusses the implications of their findings for setting environmental conditions to limit damage, which could fall under the sub-category of Cybersecurity (cs.CYBER). Finally, the paper discusses how their results replicate risk-taking related phenomena, which could fall under the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
